alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 6:55PM EDT until July 01 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Mecklenburg County in south central Virginia... Eastern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Southwestern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Southwestern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Brunswick County in south central Virginia... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 655 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Victoria, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Kenbridge around 700 PM EDT. Dundas around 710 PM EDT. Alberta around 720 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Gary, Bacons Fork, Cochran, Irby, Gills Corner, Loves Mill, Rawlings, Barrows Store, Murdocks and Forkland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
